summary: Improper payments have continued to grow in the Medicaid program , despite efforts to reduce them. The federal-state health care program spent about $596 billion in FY2017, with an estimated $37 billion of federal spending going to improper payments—that's up from $29.1 billion in 2015. This testimony, which is based on numerous GAO reports from the last 3 years, focuses on additional actions needed to...
title: Medicaid: Opportunities for Improving Program Oversight [Reissued with Revisions Apr. 13, 2018]
